TopicTitle: Access Violation: Crashes When I try to go anywhere past main menu

Articles.Content:
This is a link to the crash log folder which I through up on google drive:

https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B00NH0Z7gdOHcDhCaEkyYjVORjQ&usp=sharing

I'm running KSP on my laptop. I've run it on my laptop this last spring, it kept me awake during really boring lectures. I've since formatted the laptop because of poor decisions, so I'm not ruling out driver errors.

The game launches just fine, and I can navigate all the menus. As soon as I try to launch one of the game modes, it crashes, and the error log says there is an Access Violation.

I can navigate the settings, and set up the career mode settings, choose which game type I want.

I can't: Load a game, get past the initial start up of any of the three modes (career, science, sandbox), or launch the credits.

I think earlier this year I was doing something strange to get this game going.

I'm running a 64 bit windows 7 system:

6gb of RAM

i5-4200U 1.60ghz (overclocked at 2.30ghz)

It is using Nvidia integrated graphics, which suck, and integrated audio.

What I've tried:

Launching the game in 32 bit, and 64 bit.

Launching the game with -force- opengpl in the steam launch options.

Launching the game with -force-opengl -popupwindow in the steam window

Ensuring all the executables are run in admin mode.

Un-installed and re-installed it.

Updated my graphics drivers.

Updated my audio drivers.

Deleted Settings.cfg

any help would be appreciated!

Edited December 23, 2014 by DoktorNik
updating more info + Clarification

This is a link to the crash log folder which I through up on google drive:

https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B00NH0Z7gdOHcDhCaEkyYjVORjQ&usp=sharing

I'm running KSP on my laptop. I've run it on my laptop this last spring, it kept me awake during really boring lectures. I've since formatted the laptop because of poor decisions, so I'm not ruling out driver errors.

The game launches just fine, and I can navigate all the menus. As soon as I try to launch one of the game modes, it crashes, and the error log says there is an Access Violation at 0x00000000

What I've tried:

Launching the game in 32 bit, and 64 bit.

Launching the game with -force- opengpl

Ensuring all the executables are run in admin mode.

any help would be appreciated!

I don't know anything about how to read that crash report, but one thing that you can try is re-install Kerbal Space Program. Of course you should make a copy of your saves, (Or your games) then copy them over once you re-install Kerbal Space Program. Good luck!

Updated with more things that I've tried. (re-installing, updating drivers)

Still, crashes when I try to go into one of the three modes (Career, Science, and Sandbox). Also, it crashes when I load up credits. I'm beginning to think I did something really strange to get it working back in this year's spring.

I'm beginning to think I did something really strange to get it working back in this year's spring.

-force-opengl -popupwindow perhaps? Also best to keep away from 64-bit completely for now, it's experimental and only really any use if you start installing lots of big mods.
Just tried to launch it with -force-opengl -popupwindow in the steam launch settings, no success, menus work great, but crashes when I try to launch the game or the credits.
Try increasing the size of your swap file.
